messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Digest #### Subjects
messages.msgSnippet: No rules....but it would be more thoughtfull to voluntarily give a hint about what the subject matter is. Thanks for bringing it up.  I often delete the Digest
messages.messageBody:
No rules....but it would be more thoughtfull to
voluntarily give a hint about what the subject matter
is. Thanks for bringing it up. I often delete the
Digest identified posts, too.
Sharon

--- Homeschool4us123@... wrote:

> However, I did want to ask
> nicely if those on digest can change the subject
> line? It's hard to filter
> through what goes with what line of conversation.
> Because of the number of
> e-mails coming through my inbox lately I've just
> taken to deleting the ones
> that have only a digest number in the subject line.
> It's my loss, I know.
>
> Anyway, no matter what you gals choose, I normally
> will read them, even if
> you put NO SUBJECT HERE BECAUSE I DON'T FEEL LIKE
> IT.
>
> LOL
>
> Kimberly U

messages.subject: Digest #### Subjects
messages.msgSnippet: I m not sure if this list has any rules about subject headings, I really don t care because rules are many times stupid. However, I did want to ask nicely if
messages.messageBody:
I'm not sure if this list has any rules about subject headings, I really
don't care because rules are many times stupid. However, I did want to ask
nicely if those on digest can change the subject line? It's hard to filter
through what goes with what line of conversation. Because of the number of
e-mails coming through my inbox lately I've just taken to deleting the ones
that have only a digest number in the subject line. It's my loss, I know.

Anyway, no matter what you gals choose, I normally will read them, even if
you put NO SUBJECT HERE BECAUSE I DON'T FEEL LIKE IT.

LOL

Kimberly U


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
